column2: 法国人多次与西班牙和后来独立的荷兰共和国争夺该镇的控制权。 1645 年 3 月，奥尔良公爵加斯东 (Gaston, Duke of Orléans) 夺取了它，但几个月后再次将其输给了西班牙人。

column1: In 1658 Turenne expelled two Irish regiments in the pay of the Spanish who were garrisoning Cassel.
column2: 1658 年，Turenne 驱逐了两个爱尔兰军团，以支付驻守 Cassel 的西班牙人的薪水。

column1: The French captured the town in July 1676 under Louis de Crevant, Duke of Humières and strengthened the castle.
column2: 1676 年 7 月，法国人在休米埃尔公爵路易·德·克雷万特 (Louis de Crevant, Duke of Humières) 的领导下占领了该镇，并加固了城堡。

column1: The following year, a third Battle of Cassel took place just west of the town on 11 April 1677 when a French army under François-Henri de Montmorency, duc de Luxembourg and Philippe I of Orléans defeated Dutch forces commanded by William III of Orange.
column2: 次年，第三次 Cassel 战役于 1677 年 4 月 11 日在该镇以西发生，当时弗朗索瓦·亨利·德·蒙莫朗西，卢森堡公爵 (François-Henri de Montmorency, duc de Luxembourg) 和奥尔良公爵菲利普一世 (Philippe I of Orléans) 领导的法国军队击败了奥兰治亲王威廉三世 (William III of England) 指挥的荷兰军队。

column1: The battle took place after King Louis XIV of France besieged the Dutch-held town of Saint-Omer during the Franco–Dutch War.
column2: 这场战役发生在法国国王路易十四在法荷战争期间围攻荷兰控制的圣奥梅尔镇 (Saint-Omer) 之后。

column1: William sent an army to relieve Saint-Omer but was defeated at the village of Zuytpeene just to the west of Cassel, losing 7-8,000 men killed or wounded and another 4,000 taken prisoner.
column2: 威廉派出一支军队去解救圣奥梅尔镇 (Saint-Omer)，但在 Cassel 以西的 Zuytpeene 村被击败，损失了 7,000-8,000 人死亡或受伤，另有 4,000 人被俘。

column1: Saint-Omer fell a week later.
column2: 一周后，圣奥梅尔镇 (Saint-Omer) 被攻陷。

column1: Cassel was annexed to France the following year under the terms of the Treaty of Nijmegen, which ended the war.
column2: 次年，Cassel 根据《奈梅亨条约》(Treaty of Nijmegen) 的条款被并入法国，结束了战争。

column1: The annexation led to the town's defences being dismantled; it was considered indefensible, as it was within easy firing range of the nearby Mont des Récollets, and it would have cost far too much to fortify both hills.
column2: 吞并导致该镇的防御工事被拆除；这被认为是无法防卫的，因为该镇在附近的 Mont des Récollets 的轻松射击范围内，而且加固两座山丘的成本太高。

column1: In addition, the revised frontier following the treaty was now a significant distance from Cassel and without the proximity of the border, the town was no longer seen as having much strategic significance.
column2: 此外，根据条约修订的边界现在距离 Cassel 很远，没有边界的接近，该镇不再被视为具有太大的战略意义。

column1: During the French Revolutionary Wars, Cassel is said to have been the hill up which the Grand Old Duke of York marched his 10,000 men before he "marched them down again".
column2: 在法国大革命战争期间，据说 Cassel 是大老约克公爵 (Grand Old Duke of York) 在「再次将他们赶下」之前他的10,000名士兵行进的山丘。

column1: While it is true that Prince Frederick, Duke of York and Albany, did command an army in the Flanders Campaign of 1793 and was probably in the vicinity, the link with Cassel is considered dubious as the eponymous nursery rhyme appears to have originated well before the Revolutionary Wars.
column2: 虽然腓特烈王子 (Prince Frederick, Duke of York and Albany) 确实在 1793 年的佛兰德斯战役 (Flanders Campaign) 中指挥过一支军队，并且可能就在附近，但与 Cassel 的联系被认为是可疑的，因为同名的童谣似乎起源于独立战争之前。

column1: The population of Cassel grew to about 4,200 people by the mid-19th century.
column2: 到 19 世纪中叶，Cassel 的人口成长到约4 ,200 人。

column1: Benjamin Disraeli, later to become Prime Minister of the United Kingdom, stayed there for a month in September–October 1845 and wrote in a letter to his sister Sarah that he considered it "an extremely savage place; few of the inhabitants, & none of the humbler classes, talk French, there is no library, bookseller's shop, nor newspaper of any sort ...
column2: 班杰明·迪斯雷利 (Benjamin Disraeli) 后来成为英国首相，于 1845 年 9 月至 10 月在那里停留了一个月，并在给妹妹莎拉的一封信中写道，他认为这是「一个极其野蛮的地方；少数居民，和没有一个谦逊的阶层、讲法语、没有图书馆、书店、也没有任何形式的报纸......

column1: It is quite French Flanders, their provisions come from Holland, the Hotel de Ville was built by the Spaniards, the carillons are perpetually sounding, & religion is supreme."
column2: 这是相当法国法兰德斯地区 (French Flanders)，他们的食物来自荷兰，市政厅是由西班牙人建造，钟琴永远悠扬，且宗教至高无上。

column1: In 1848, Cassel gained a railway connection when the Lille-Dunkirk line was built.
column2: 1848 年，Cassel 在里尔-敦克尔克线 (Lille-Dunkirk) 建成时获得了铁路连接。

column1: The station is, however, at the foot of the hill at Oxelaëre some 3 kilometres (1.9 mi) from the centre of Cassel.
column2: 然而，该车站位于 Oxelaëre 山脚下，距离 Cassel 市中心约3公里（1.9英里）。

column1: To link the two places, an electric tramway was built under the auspices of the Compagnie des Tramways de Cassel, which operated between 1900 and 1934. It was replaced by a bus link which still operates today.
column2: 为了连接这两个地方，在1900年至1934年间运营的 Compagnie des Tramways de Cassel 的赞助下建造了一条电动有轨电车，它被今天仍在运营的公车线路所取代。

column1: Cassel served as the headquarters of Marshal Ferdinand Foch during the early part of the First World War, between October 1914 and May 1915.
column2: Cassel 在第一次世界大战初期（1914 年 10 月至 1915 年 5 月）担任马歇尔‧斐迪南‧佛区 (Marshal Ferdinand Foch) 指挥官。

column1: Kruščica belonged to a group of concentration camps in the Independent State of Croatia where mass executions of inmates were performed.
column2: Kruščica 属于克罗埃西亚独立国 (Independent State of Croatia) 的一群集中营，在那里大规模处决囚犯。

column1: During first two months of the functioning of the camp, local residents killed three thousand people within it.
column2: 在集中营运作的前两个月，当地居民杀死了其中的三千人。

column1: At the end of July 1941, the Ustaše, under the command of Boško Cvjenćek, captured and transported a group of 74 Serbs from Pale to the Kruščica camp with the false explanation that they were going to work and earn money.
column2: 1941 年 7 月底，乌斯塔沙人 (Ustaše) 在 Boško Cvjenćek 的指挥下，俘虏了一群 74 名塞尔维亚人 (Serbs)，并将其从帕莱 (Pale) 运送到克鲁斯奇卡 (Kruščica) 集中营，并谎称他们要工作和赚钱。

column1: All of them were killed.
column2: 他们都被杀了。

column1: All of them were cruelly massacred by Ustaše during the night on 5 August 1941.
column2: 在 1941 年 8 月 5 日的夜间，他们所有人都被乌斯塔沙人残忍地屠杀。

column1: According to a 2001 work published by Hrvatski informativni centar and authored by Topalović, imprisoned Serbs were actually political prisoners who attacked the Ustaše, attempting to kill them, refusing all calls for surrender, so the Ustaše were forced to kill them.
column2: 根据 Hrvatski informativni centar 于 2001 年出版并由 Topalović 著作的一部作品，被监禁的塞尔维亚人实际上是政治犯，他们袭击且试图杀死乌斯塔沙人，并且拒绝了所有投降的呼吁，因此乌斯塔沙人被迫杀死他们。

column1: Topalović also emphasized that the Ustaše commander of the camp, Josip Tehler was killed attempting to suppress the rebellion.
column2: Topalović 还强调，集中营的乌斯塔沙指挥官 Josip Tehler 在试图镇压叛乱时被杀。

column1: The first transport of inmates arrived at Kruščica between 28 August and 1 September 1941, when around 1,000 people, mostly Jewish women and children, were transported from concentration camps on Pag and in Gospić.
column2: 1941 年 8 月 28 日至 9 月 1 日之间第一批囚犯抵达克鲁斯奇卡，当时约有 1,000 人（其中大多数是犹太妇女和儿童）从帕格 (Pag) 和戈斯皮奇 (Gospić) 的集中营被运走。

column1: During the night of 3 September 1941, members of the Ustaše broke into the houses of Jewish residents of Sarajevo, captured the inhabitants, and transported them to Kruščica.
column2: 1941 年 9 月 3 日夜间，乌斯塔沙成员闯入塞拉耶佛 (Sarajevo) 犹太居民的房屋，俘虏了居民，并将他们运送到克鲁斯奇卡。

column1: The next day, the Ustaše plundered the homes of imprisoned Jewish victims.
column2: 第二天，乌斯塔沙人掠夺了被监禁的犹太受害者的家园。

column1: At the beginning of September 1941, there were approximately 3,000 people interned in Kruščica camp, including 300 Serb women and children, with the remainder being Jews.
column2: 1941 年 9 月初，大约有 3,000 人被关押在克鲁什奇察集中营，其中包括 300 名塞尔维亚妇女和儿童，其余是犹太人。

column1: All were housed in two buildings, 80 people to each room, without basic living conditions.
column2: 所有人都住在两栋楼中，每个房间 80 人，没有基本的生活条件。

column1: The Jewish community from Zagreb sent carloads of packages to inmates in Kruščica.
column2: 来自萨格勒布 (Zagreb) 的犹太社区寄送了一车包裹给克鲁斯奇卡的囚犯。

column1: Local Ustaše burned these before the eyes of hungry children and women, who were unable to retrieve anything.
column2: 当地的乌斯塔沙人在饥饿的儿童和妇女眼前烧毁了这些，他们无法取回任何东西。

column1: It was difficult to accommodate and feed the inmates of this camp, so the Ustaše decided to resolve this difficulty by torturing inmates with forced labour and hunger and by killing them.
column2: 这个集中营的囚犯很难容纳和喂养他们，所以乌斯塔沙人决定以强迫劳动和饥饿方式折磨囚犯并杀死他们来解决此困难。

column1: The camp was destroyed after the Second World War.
column2: 该集中营在第二次世界大战后被摧毁。

column1: One building was restored, and a memorial area, occupying around 2,000 m² was established, consisting of the restored building (containing a museum), a monument created by Fadil Bilić, incorporating a text from Ivan Goran Kovačić's poem Jama, and several memorial plaques commemorating communities interned in the camp (including those from Zenica and Pale).
column2: 一座建筑被修复，并建立了一个占地约 2,000 平方公尺的纪念区，这包括经过修复的建筑（包含博物馆），由 Fadil Bilić 设立的纪念碑，融合了 Ivan Goran Kovačić's 的诗歌 Jama 的本文，以及几块纪念集中营中被拘留的社区（包括 Zenica 和 Pale 的纪念碑）。

column1: This memorial area became known as the 'Black House' (Crna kuća).
column2: 这个纪念区被称为「黑屋」 (Crna kuća)。

column1: During the War in Bosnia & Herzegovina, the museum's contents were removed.
column2: 在波士尼亚与赫塞哥维纳 (Bosnia & Herzegovina) 战争期间，博物馆的内容被去除了。

column1: In 2014, the site was declared a National Monument of Bosnia and Herzegovina.
column2: 2014 年，该遗址被宣布为波士尼亚与赫塞哥维纳国家纪念碑。

column1: Originally, Silberling envisioned employing novice actors in the lead roles, but acknowledged performers with the level of recognition of Cage and Meg Ryan would attract support for the production.
column2: 布莱德 (Silberling) 原先想雇用新秀演员担任主角，但明白演技深受肯定的凯吉 (Cage) 和梅格·莱恩 (Meg Ryan) 对于制片将成为具吸引力的支持。

column1: After having completed action-oriented roles in The Rock, Con Air and Face/Off, Cage was eager to star in a more profound film when he received Stevens' screenplay.
column2: 凯奇在演出《绝地任务》(The Rock)、《空中监狱》(Con Air) 和《变脸》(Face/Off) 等动作片角色后，在接到史蒂文斯 (Stevens) 的剧本后，渴望出演一部更深刻的电影。

column1: He agreed to accept the role, noting the spiritual issues in the story and the impact it had on him, but not elaborating on his own beliefs.
column2: 凯奇同意担任赛斯 (Seth) 角色，他注意到故事中的灵性议题及其对他的影响，但没有详细说明自己的信仰。

column1: Ryan also agreed to accept the role of Maggie, remarking "I don't know if angels are floating around, but the idea that there's a guiding force is something I embrace".
column2: 莱恩也同意担任玛姬 (Maggie) 这个角色，他说：「我不知道天使是否漂浮在周围，但有一种引导力的想法是我所接受的。」

column1: Andre Braugher, an actor on the television series Homicide: Life on the Street, was able to work on the project while Homicide was on break before the beginning of its sixth season.
column2: 电视剧《情理法的春天》（Homicide: Life on the Street）的演员安德鲁·布瑞格 (Andre Braugher) 在《情理法的春天》第六季开始前的休息时间期间，他能够参与这部电影。

column1: His new co-star Dennis Franz was also starring on a police procedural series, NYPD Blue.
column2: 他的新联合主演丹尼斯·法兰兹 (Dennis Franz) 还出演了一部警察程序系列剧《纽约重案组》(NYPD Blue)。

column1: Cage said that with this role, he had to switch from his regular methods of constant movements to trying to be "effective" while often still.
column2: 凯奇说，由于演出这个角色，他必须从保持定期经常运动转变为试图「有效率」的运动。

column1: He remarked on having to adopt the mindset of a child, and act impressed by commonplace experiences such as feeling rain or sunlight.
column2: 他评论说，必须怀有赤子之心，并对感受雨水或阳光等司空见惯的体验有印象深刻。

column1: A rig for the camera was built for the scene where the angelic Seth sees Maggie look in the mirror, and the crew shot the mirror without the actors for one take so Cage's reflection could be edited out from the take with both.
column2: 为天使般的赛斯看到玛姬照镜子的场景建造了一个摄影机装备，工作人员在没有演员的情况下拍摄了镜子，使得可以从拍摄中编辑出凯奇的反射。

column1: Other special effects involved a "going to the light" afterlife depiction, in which Seth walks with a little girl, played by Sarah Dampf, who has died.
column2: 其他特效涉及「走向光明」的来世描绘，其中赛斯与一个小女孩一起走路，这名小女孩由已经去世的莎拉·丹普夫 (Sarah Dampf) 饰演。

column1: After cinematographer John Seale shot the scene in a hallway, Sony Pictures Imageworks' John Nelson increased the brightness to end in white, adding splinters of light.
column2: 在摄影师约翰·西尔 (John Seale) 在走廊里拍摄了这个场景后，索尼图形影象动作公司 (Sony Pictures Imageworks) 的约翰•尼尔森 (John Nelson) 将亮度加到白色，增添光的碎片。

column1: Some of the film was shot at Lake Tahoe's surrounding areas and Kern County.
column2: 这部电影的部分内容是在太浩湖 (Lake Tahoe) 的周边地区和克恩郡 (Kern County) 拍摄。

column1: The "falling" scene was partially shot at the Los Angeles Bank of America, while Cage was placed on a moving rig over a bluescreen.
column2: 「坠落」的场景部分是在洛杉矶美国银行拍摄的，而凯奇则在蓝幕上方的移动钻机上。

column1: Ryan's death scene was filmed on Old Mill Road in Crestline, California.
column2: 莱恩的死亡场景是在加州克雷斯特莱恩 (Crestline) 的 Old Mill Road 拍摄。

column1: The library scenes were shot at San Francisco Public Library.
column2: 图书馆场景是在旧金山公立图书馆 (San Francisco Public Library) 拍摄。

column1: For angel scenes shot at Malibu Beach, though the characters are not physical beings, it was decided that the angels would have briefly visible footprints to avoid the perception that the sand was too hard to leave imprints.
column2: 对于在马里布海滩 (Malibu Beach) 拍摄的天使场景，虽然角色不是有形存在体，但决定天使会有短暂的可见脚印，以避免人们认为沙子太难留下印记。

column1: Thus, Nelson erased the footprints soon after they are first seen.
column2: 因此，尼尔森 (Nelson) 在第一次看到脚印后不久就把它们抹去了。

column1: The score was composed by Gabriel Yared, often using three notes to convey ascent.
column2: 电影配乐由盖布瑞·雅德 (Gabriel Yared) 作曲，通常使用三个音符来传达上天堂。

column1: Pop synthesizers, pianos and strings were used for the three-note compositions where the angels observe Los Angeles, where the child in the prologue dies and where Seth experiences Maggie's despair, respectively.
column2: 在天使观察洛杉矶、序幕中的孩子死亡和赛斯分别经历玛姬的绝望等三段场景中使用流行合成器、钢琴及弦乐作为配乐。

column1: Yared also employed violins and celli, sometimes using one to accompany a line of voice-over dialogue and another for follow-up dialogue.
column2: 雅德还使用小提琴和大提琴，有时使用一把小提琴伴奏一行旁白对话，另一把伴奏后续对话。

column1: With the entry of Japan into the war, Fairley flew to Java in January 1942.
column2: 随着日本参战，费尔利 (Fairley) 于 1942 年 1 月飞往爪哇 (Java)。

column1: Fairley was well aware that Java produced 90% of the world's supply of quinine and that the implications would be serious if Java was lost.
column2: 费尔利很清楚，爪哇生产世界上 90% 的奎宁供应，如果爪哇沦陷，影响将极严重。

column1: He arranged for the purchase of all available stocks of quinine, some 120 long tons (120 t).
column2: 他安排购买所有可用的奎宁库存，约 120 长吨 (120 t)。

column1: Fairley was informed that the quinine had been loaded on board two ships.
column2: 费尔利被告知奎宁已被装载在两艘船上。

column1: One was never seen again.
column2: 其中一艘船再也没见过。

column1: The other, the SS Klang, reached Fremantle in March.
column2: 另一艘船是党卫军巴生号 (SS Klang)，于三月抵达弗里曼特尔 (Fremantle)。

column1: Although 20 long tons (20 t) of quinine was loaded on board, it was apparently unloaded when the ship stopped at Tjilatjap, possibly due to fifth columnists.
column2: 虽然船上装载了 20 长吨 (20 t) 奎宁，但当船停在 Tjilatjap 时，显然被卸货了，嫌疑人可能是第五纵队成员。

column1: Thus, none of the shipment reached Australia.
column2: 因此，没有一批奎宁到达澳大利亚。

column1: Fairley himself departed Java with the I Corps staff on the transport Orcades on 21 February 1942 shortly before Java fell.
column2: 费尔利本人于 1942 年 2 月 21 日与第一军团参谋人员在爪哇沦陷前不久乘坐运输队一起离开爪哇。

column1: In General Sir Thomas Blamey's reorganisation of the Australian Army in April 1942, Fairley was appointed director of medicine at Allied Land Forces Headquarters (LHQ) in Melbourne.
column2: 1942 年 4 月，托马斯·布莱梅 (Thomas Blamey) 爵士对澳大利亚陆军进行了重组，费尔利被任命为墨尔本盟军陆军总部 (LHQ) 医学主任。

column1: Fairley was soon facing a series of medical emergencies caused by the Kokoda Track campaign.
column2: 费尔利很快就面临由科科达小径战役 (Kokoda Track campaign) 引起的一系列医疗紧急情况。

column1: An epidemic of bacillary dysentery was headed off by Fairley's decision to rush all available supplies of sulphaguanadine to New Guinea.
column2: 由于费尔利决定将所有可用的磺胍定 (sulphaguanadine) 供应紧急运往新几内亚，阻止了杆菌性痢疾的流行。

column1: On Fairley's advice every man who complained of diarrhoea was given the drug and the epidemic was brought under control in ten days.
column2: 由于费尔利决定将所有可用的磺胍定 (sulphaguanadine) 供应紧急运往新几内亚，阻止了杆菌性痢疾的流行。

column1: But Fairley's main concern was malaria.
column2: 但费尔利主要关心的是疟疾。

column1: Despite the experience with malaria in the Middle East, most of the troops had a poor understanding of anti-malaria precautions and few medical officers had encountered the disease.
column2: 尽管大多数部队在中东有疟疾方面的经验，但对抗疟疾预防措施知之甚少，很少有医务人员遇到过这种疾病。

column1: In combination with critical shortages of drugs and anti-malarial supplies such as netting, insecticides and repellents, the result was a medical disaster.
column2: 再加上蚊帐、杀虫剂和驱虫剂等药物和抗疟疾用品严重短缺，结果是一场医疗灾难。

column1: In the 13-week period from 31 October 1942 to 1 January 1943, the Army reported 4,137 battle casualties, but 14,011 casualties from tropical diseases, of which 12,240 were from malaria.
column2: 在 1942 年 10 月 31 日至 1943 年 1 月 1 日的 13 周内，陆军报告 4,137 名战斗伤亡，但 14,011 人死于热带疾病，其中 12,240人 死于疟疾。

column1: The government grimly contemplated disbanding divisions to replace malaria casualties.
column2: 政府严厉考虑解散各部门以取代疟疾伤亡。

column1: Our worst enemy in New Guinea, General Blamey declared, "is not the Nip—it’s the bite."
column2: 布莱梅将军宣称，「我们在新几内亚最大的敌人，不是日本人，而是咬人。」

column1: This caused Blamey to despatch a medical mission headed by Fairley to the United States and the United Kingdom in September 1942 to present the Army's case for a more adequate and equitable share of anti-malarial supplies.
column2: 这导致布莱梅于 1942 年 9 月派遣了一支由费尔利率领的医疗团前往美国和英国，向陆军提出更充分、更公平地分配抗疟疾物资的理由。

column1: Illinois farmer David Johnson built his 31-foot-tall (9.4 m) goat tower in Shelby County, near Findlay, after seeing an article on Fairview in the magazine Decanter.
column2: 伊利诺伊州 (Illinois) 农民 David Johnson 在芬德利 (Findlay) 附近的谢尔比郡 (Shelby County) 建造了他的31英尺高 (9.4米) 的山羊塔，他在《品醇客》(Decanter) 杂志上看到了一篇关于 Fairview 的文章。

column1: Another goat tower was built in the outdoor-seating area of Silky O'Sullivan's bar in Memphis, Tennessee on Beale Street.
column2: 另一座山羊塔建在田纳西州孟菲斯市区比尔街 (Memphis, Tennessee on Beale Street) 的 Silky O'Sullivan 酒吧的户外座位区。

column1: In a Waunakee, Wisconsin goat petting zoo, a goat tower was built by the Endres family.
column2: 在威斯康星州 Waunakee 的山羊宠物动物园，Endres 家族建造了一座山羊塔。

column1: The tower was designed in a Bavarian style to match other buildings of the area.
column2: 为了匹配该地区的其他建筑，该塔的设计采用巴伐利亚风格。

column1: The owners claim it is the fifth goat tower ever constructed after the ones in Fairview, the “Tower of Baaa” in Findlay, Memphis, and Ekeby.
column2: 业主声称这是继 Fairview、Findlay、Memphis 和 Ekeby 的「Tower of Baaa」之后建造的第五座山羊塔。

column1: Life at the Bottom has received mostly positive reviews.
column2: 《底层生活》(Life at the Bottom) 获得了大多推崇的评价。

column1: Gregory Schneider of the Topeka Capital-Journal called the collection "the best exploration of the problems of poverty ever written." America magazine writer, Peter Heinegg, considered the essays to be a "barrage of breathtakingly horrible true-life...stories", but he said that Dalrymple puts too much of his personal "snorting indignation" into the text without letting the reader draw their own conclusions.
column2: 《托彼卡首府日报》(Topeka Capital-Journal) 的 Gregory Schneider 称该集是「有史以来对贫困问题的最佳探索」。美国杂志作家 Peter Heinegg 认为这些文章是「令人叹为观止的可怕真实生活的弹幕......故事」，但他说，Dalrymple 将太多他个人的「嗤之以鼻的愤慨」放入内文中，而没有让读者得出自己的结论。

column1: He ended by saying, "Dalrymple's case sounds like a paranoid tirade or perverse tribute, but it is at least partially redeemed by the barrage of breathtakingly horrible true-life (one assumes) stories that this very angry doctor tells...to bolster it." John Clark of Liberty magazine called it "so compelling...that I read it cover to cover in a day's time—and later reread it twice."
column2: 他最后说：「Dalrymple的案件听起来像是偏执狂的长篇大论或反常的致敬，但它至少部分地被这个非常愤怒的医生讲述的令人叹为观止的可怕的真实生活 (人们假设) 故事所救赎......以加强它。」《自由》(Liberty) 杂志的 John Clark 称其为「如此引人注目......我在一天的时间内一遍又一遍地读了它-后来又重读了两遍。」

column1: Thomas Sowell, a pundit and social critic, described it as "brilliant and insightful" in Capitalism magazine and "an insightful and devastating eyewitness account of the white underclass in Britain" in the Jewish World Review.
column2: 权威人士和社会评论家 Thomas Sowell 在《资本主义》(Capitalism) 杂志上将其描述为「辉煌而富有洞察力」，并在《犹太世界评论》 (Jewish World Review) 上称其为「对英国白人下层阶层阶级的深刻而毁灭性的目击者描述」。

column1: Overall, Sowell said that the collection was able to explain that "One of the most telling examples of the social destructiveness of the left's welfare-state vision can be found among the white slum dwellers in Britain." Atlanta Journal-Constitution writer, Theresa K. Weaver, called the collection "saddening, infuriating, and ultimately not terribly empowering", stating that she wishes Dalrymple "might at least offer a few ideas on turning everything around." Arthur Foulkes of the Carolina Journal described it as a "fine book" that "offers much to friends of liberty everywhere." Roger Donway of The Atlas Society considered it to be "one of the most instructive books that I have read in many years".
column2: 整体而言，Sowell 说，这些作品集能够解释「左翼福利国家愿景的社会破坏性的最明显的例子之一可以在英国的白人贫民窟居民中找到。」《亚特兰大宪法报》(Atlanta Journal-Constitution) 的作者 Theresa K. Weaver 称该系列「令人悲伤，令人愤怒，最终并不是非常强大」，并表示她希望Dalrymple「至少可以提供一些关于扭转一切的想法」。 《卡罗来纳日报》(Carolina Journal) 的 Arthur Foulkes 将其描述为一本「好书」，「为世界各地的自由朋友提供了很多意涵」。 《阿特拉斯协会》(The Atlas Society) 的 Roger Donway 认为它是「我多年来读过的最具启发性的书之一」。

column1: Stephen Goode, writing for Insight on the News, said that the collection argued its "position brilliantly and with impressive passion".
column2: Stephen Goode 为《新闻透视》(Insight on the News) 撰稿称，该系列「出色地、以令人印象深刻的热情论证了自己的地位」。

column1: The National Observer wrote that it "has much value", if it is taken as an "antidote to fashionable loose thinking".
column2: 《国家观察员》(National Observer) 写道，如果该系列被视为「时髦松散思维的解毒剂」，就「具有很大价值」。

column1: Phips arrived back in Boston in the summer of 1688 and was welcomed back as a hero.
column2: Phips 于 1688 年夏天回到波士顿，并受到英雄般欢迎。

column1: His wife seemed very happy to see him.
column2: 他的妻子看到他似乎很高兴。

column1: He was celebrated in sermons and at the Harvard college commencement he was compared to Jason fetching the Golden Fleece.
column2: 他在布道中受到赞扬，在哈佛大学的毕业典礼上，他被比作 Jason 拿金羊毛。

column1: Andros and Randolph were not so happy to see him and it seems the feeling was mutual.
column2: Andros 和 Randolph 见到他并不那么高兴，似乎这种感觉是相互的。

column1: Almost all of New England was unified in their opposition to Andros and Randolph.
column2: 几乎整个新英格兰都团结一致反对 Andros 和 Randolph。

column1: Phips, despite having been captain of Randolph's gunship in 1683-4, does not seem to have carried an association with Randolph in the minds of the people of Massachusetts Bay.
column2: Phip 尽管在 1683-1684 年担任 Randolph 炮舰机的机长，但在麻萨诸塞湾 (Massachusetts Bay) 人民的心目中似乎对 Randolph 没有印象。

column1: Andros swore Phips into his new post in early July, but his council refused Phips' demand that the previously named sheriffs be dismissed.
column2: Andros 使 Phips 在七月初宣誓就职，但 Phips 解雇先前任命的治安官的要求遭议会拒绝。

column1: If Phips had simply wanted a share in the spoils of the Dominion, he might have stuck around and kept his head down.
column2: 如果 Phips 只是想分享自治领地的战利品，他可能会留下来且保持低调。

column1: Instead he stayed home in Boston only six weeks before shipping back to London to join with Increase Mather in opposing the Dominion and seeking to restore the original charter.
column2: 反而是，他只在波士顿的家中呆了六个星期，然后运回伦敦，与 Increase Mather 一起反对自治领地，并试图恢复原始宪章。

column1: This seems to be the first mention of Phips in Increase Mather's diary or correspondence.
column2: 这似乎是在 Increase Mather 的日记或信件中第一次提到 Phips。

column1: Motivated by a shared dislike of Andros, Phips and Increase Mather worked together to bring about his downfall.
column2: 在对 Andros 的共同厌恶的驱使下，Phips 和 Increase Mather 共同努力，导致了他的垮台。

column1: After the Glorious Revolution in late 1688 replaced the Catholic James with the Protestant monarchs William III and Mary II, Phips and Mather petitioned the new monarchs for restoration of the Massachusetts charter, and successfully convinced the Lords of Trade to delay the transmission of formal instructions about the change of power to Andros.
column2: 1688年末光荣革命 (Glorious Revolution) 以新教君主威廉三世 (William III) 和玛丽二世 (Mary II) 取代天主教的 James 后，Phips 和 Mather 请求新君主恢复马萨诸塞州宪章，并成功地说服贸易局 (Board of Trade) 推迟向 Andros 传递关于权力更迭的正式指示。

column1: Phips returned to Boston in May 1689, carrying proclamations from the king and queen, and found Andros and Randolph had already been arrested in a revolt in Boston.
column2: 1689 年 5 月，Phips 带着国王和王后的诏书回到波士顿，发现 Andros 和 Randolph 已经在波士顿的一次叛乱中被捕。

column1: Phips served for a time as an overseer guarding Andros and Randolph in the prison at Castle Island.
column2: Phips 曾一度担任监视者，在城堡岛 (Castle Island) 的监狱里看守 Andros 和 Randolph。

column1: If Paris were worth a mass to Henry IV, Boston was worth a conversion, in the Puritan sense, to William Phips.
column2: 如果对亨利四世 (Henry IV) 来说巴黎确实值得举行弥撒，则在清教徒的意义上，波士顿就值得任命给 William Phips。

column1: The turmoil in England and William's accession to the throne had prompted New France's Governor to take advantage of the political turmoil in New England, launching a series of Indian raids across the northern frontier in 1689 and early 1690.
column2: 英格兰的动荡和威廉登基促使新法兰西总督利用新英格兰的政治动荡，在 1689 年和 1690 年初发动了一系列印第安人对北部边境的袭击。

column1: When a frontier town in Maine was overrun in early March 1690, the French were perceived as instigators and the provisional government of Massachusetts, began casting about for a major general to lead an expedition against the French in Acadia.
column2: 1690 年 3 月初，缅因州 (Maine) 的一个边防城镇被占领，法国人被视为煽动者，马萨诸塞州 (Massachusetts) 临时政府开始寻找一名少将，率领远征阿卡迪亚 (Acadia) 的法国人。

column1: Phips had not demonstrated military interests as a young man.
column2: Phips 年轻时没有展现出对军事有兴趣。

column1: During King Philip's War, when many took up arms, Phips built ships and cut lumber.
column2: 在菲利普国王战争 (King Philip's War) 期间，当许多人拿起武器时，Phips 建造了船只并砍伐木材。

column1: John Knepp's journal testifies to Phips constitutional disinterest in military discipline.
column2: John Knepp 的日记证明了 Phips 对军事纪律的漠不关心。

column1: Alongside her acting work, Kapoor has established a career as a designer.
column2: Kapoor 除了她的表演工作，还另辟设计师的职业生涯。

column1: During her five-year association with the retail chain Globus, Kapoor became the first Indian actress to launch her own line of clothing for women; she described the collaboration as being "special" and "reflective of my personal sense of style".
column2: 在与零售连锁店Globus的五年合作期间， Kapoor 成为第一位推出自己的女性服装系列的印度女演员。她将这次合作描述为「别树一帜」和「反映了我个人的风格感」。

column1: Her collection made its debut several months later in stores across India, and was well received.
column2: 几个月后，她的系列在印度各地的商店首次亮相，并受到好评。

column1: Following the end of her contract with Globus, she expressed a desire to work with a design house to release her clothing line internationally, but later explained that those plans were on hold.
column2: 在与 Globus 的合约结束后，她表示希望与一家设计公司合作，在国际上发布她的服装系列，但后来解释说，这些计划被搁置了。

column1: In August 2018, Kapoor collaborated with Lakmé Cosmetics to launch her own line of cosmetics.
column2: 2018 年 8 月，Kapoor 与 Lakmé Cosmetics 合作推出了自己的化妆品系列。

column1: In 2009, Kapoor worked with nutritionist Rujuta Diwekar on Don't Lose Your Mind, Lose Your Weight, a book which focused on the principles of healthy eating habits.
column2: 2009 年，Kapoor 与营养学家 Rujuta Diwekar 合作出版了《Don't Lose Your Mind, Lose Your Weight》这本书，这本书专注于健康饮食习惯的原则。

column1: Published by Random House Publications, the book was well received by critics, and sold 10,000 copies within its first twenty days.
column2: 这本书由兰登书屋出版社 (Random House Publications) 出版，受到评论家的好评，并在前二十天内售出 10,000 册。

column1: A follow-up titled, Women and The Weight Loss Tamasha, was released two years later.
column2: 两年后，一本名为《Women and The Weight Loss Tamasha》的后续作品上映。

column1: It addressed the weight loss concerns and eating habits of women in various parts of their life, and featured Kapoor in a voice-over for the audiobook.
column2: 内容解决了女性在生活各个阶段的减肥问题和饮食习惯，并在有声读物的旁白中展示 Kapoor。

column1: In February 2013, Kapoor released her autobiographical memoir: The Style Diary of a Bollywood Diva.
column2: 2013年2月，Kapoor 出版自传回忆录《The Style Diary of a Bollywood Diva》。

column1: Co-written alongside Rochelle Pinto, it became the first book to be launched under the Shobhaa De imprint of Penguin Books—a set of series that included celebrity memoirs, guides and biographies.
column2: Kapoor 与 Rochelle Pinto 合着，成为第一本以企鹅出版集团 (Penguin Books) 的Shobhaa De 印记推出的书，该系列包括名人回忆录、指南和传记。

column1: In a review published by Mint, Shefalee Vasudev criticised the writing style as "too-breezy" but further stated that it is "a well-produced book, reproducing chirpy little post-it notes and diet charts, punctuated with Bebo's stunning pictures from her private albums to fashion magazine covers." Later that year, she collaborated with Diwekar for the third time on The Indian Food Wisdom and The Art of Eating Right, a documentary film about nutrition.
column2: 在 Mint 发表的一篇评论中，Shefalee Vasudev 批评这种写作风格「太轻快」，但进一步表示这是「一本制作精良的书，再现了叽叽喳喳的小便利贴和饮食图表，穿插着 Bebo 从她的私人专辑到时尚杂志封面的惊人照片。」同年晚些时候，她第三次与Diwekar合作拍摄了关于营养纪录片的《The Indian Food Wisdom》和《The Art of Eating Right》。

column1: During her years in the film industry, Kapoor has been actively involved in promoting children's education and the safety of women.
column2: 在电影业的几年里，Kapoor 一直积极参与促进儿童教育和妇女安全。

column1: In June 2010, she took part in the international campaign 1GOAL Education for All, and was appointed ambassador for the Shakti Campaign—a project launched by NDTV to combat violence against women—in commemoration of the 100th anniversary of International Women's Day.
column2: 2010 年 6 月，她参加由 NDTV 发起「1GOAL 全民教育」国际运动，并被任命为 Shakti 运动的大使，此运动旨在打击暴力侵害妇女行为，以纪念国际妇女节 100 周年。

column1: Two years later, Kapoor launched Channel V's anti-rape mobile app 'VithU'; she stated that with an increasing amount of violence against women in India, "[i]t [was] important for actors to stand up for issues because they can reach out to a lot of people."
column2: 两年后，Kapoor 推出了第五频道的反强奸移动应用程式「VithU」；她说，随着印度针对妇女的暴力事件越来越多，「对于行动者来说，挺身而出解决问题非常重要，因为他们可以接触到很多人。」

column1: In January 2014, Kapoor began working with UNICEF to advocate the education of girls and increase quality based education in India.
column2: 2014 年 1 月，Kapoor 开始与联合国儿童基金会合作，宣导印度女童教育，提高优质教育水准。

column1: Speaking of her association, she expressed hope in creating places "where children feel safe and secure, and where interactive and creative tools are used to ensure that children are happy and learning." During the first year, Kapoor visited schools in the states of Rajasthan and Maharashtra where she interacted with students and participated in fundraising events hosted by the Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalaya organisation in the Jalna district.
column2: 在谈到她的协会时，她表示希望创造「孩子们感到安全和有保障的地方，以及使用互动和创造性工具来确保孩子们快乐和学习的地方。」在第一年，Kapoor 造访拉拉贾斯坦 (Rajasthan) 和马哈拉施特拉邦 (Maharashtra) 的学校并且与学生互动，也参加了由贾尔纳 (Jalna ) 区 Kasturba Gandhi Balika Vidyalaya 组织主办的筹款活动。

column1: Along with UNICEF India's Goodwill Ambassador (Sharmila Tagore), Kapoor hosted a charity dinner to help raise awareness for the development of underprivileged kids, and launched the 'Child-Friendly School and Systems' (CFSS) package.
column2: Kapoor 与联合国儿童基金会 (UNICEF) 驻印度亲善大使 Goodwill Ambassador (Sharmila Tagore) 一起举办了慈善晚宴，协肋提高对贫困儿童发展的认识，并推出了「儿童友好学校和系统」(Child-Friendly School and Systems, CFSS) 一系列计划。

column1: She later donated an equivalent amount of the funds raised during a joint initiative by UNICEF and Groupon for a higher-quality learning environment in Indian schools.
column2: 后来，她捐赠了在联合国儿童基金会 (UNICEF) 和 Groupon 联合倡议期间筹集的等量资金，用于在印度学校创造更高品质的学习环境。

column1: The following year, she awarded 31 students and 5 teachers for their contribution towards the field of education in Chhattisgarh at the concluding ceremony of Child Rights Protection week.
column2: 次年，她在儿童权利保护周的闭幕式上表彰了31名学生和5名教师，以表彰他们对恰蒂斯加尔邦 (Chhattisgarh) 教育领域的贡献。

column1: In the Bahamas after the storm, a boat sailed from Nassau to deliver food and building materials to Eleuthera.
column2: 在巴哈马群岛，风暴过后，一艘运送食物和建筑材料的船从拿骚 (Nassau) 驶向伊柳塞拉岛 (Eleuthera)。

column1: After the storm, the National Guard offered shelters for at least 400 homeless residents in Stuart.
column2: 风暴过后，国民警卫队为斯图尔特 (Stuart) 的至少 400 名无家可归的居民提供庇护所。

column1: Of the 7,900 families adversely affected by the hurricane, 4,325 required assistance from the American Red Cross.
column2: 有 7,900 个家庭受到飓风不利的影响，其中 4,325 个家庭需要美国红十字会的援助。

column1: Farmers in Texas, also affected by a major hurricane, requested growers in Florida wait 15 days so they could sell their citrus crop that fell.
column2: 德克萨斯州 (Texas) 的农民也受到一场大飓风的影响，他们要求佛罗里达州的种植者等待 15 天，让他们可以出售他们倒下的柑橘作物。

column1: The damaged dam near Tampa initially resulted in waters from the Hillsborough River being pumped into the city's water treatment plant, and a new dam was eventually built in 1944.
column2: 坦帕 (Tampa) 附近受损的大坝最初导致希尔斯伯勒河 (Hillsborough River) 的水流入该市的水处理厂，最终于 1944 年建造了一座新大坝。

column1: After starring in a commercial by Mr. Burns for the Springfield Nuclear Power Plant, Homer decides to be an actor.
column2: 荷马 (Homer) 主演了郭董 (Burns) 为内糊核电站 (Springfield Nuclear Power Plant) 的商业广告后，决定成为一名演员。

column1: As he fills out a Screen Actors Guild form at home, Lisa points out that he has only written his middle initial, J, in the blank for his middle name.
column2: 当他在家里填写电影演员工会表格时，莉莎 (Lisa) 指出他只在中间名的空白处写下了他的中间名首字母 J。

column1: Neither Homer nor Grampa knows that name, but Grampa takes Homer to a farm where Mona, Grampa's wife and Homer's mother, spent some time during her days as a hippie.
column2: 荷马和荷熊 (Grampa) 都不知道这个名字，但荷熊把荷马带到了一个农场，荷熊的妻子、荷马的母亲莫娜 (Mona) 在那里装作嬉皮度过了一段时间。

column1: The farm is run by two middle-aged hippies, Seth and Munchie, who were friends of Mona; they point out a mural that she painted based on an incident at Woodstock, which is dedicated to Homer and reveals his middle name as Jay.
column2: 农场由两个中年嬉皮塞斯 (Seth) 和麦奇 (Munchie) 经营，他们是莫娜的朋友。他们指出她根据伍德斯托克 (Woodstock) 的一次事件绘制的壁画中有荷马的中间名杰伊 (Jay)，该壁画是献给他的。

column1: Seeing how carefree his life would have been as a hippie, Homer decides to become one.
column2: 荷马看到嬉皮的生活是多么无忧无虑，决定成为嬉皮。

column1: He dons a dirty old poncho left behind by Mona and begins to carry a frisbee, but is dismayed to learn that Seth and Munchie are running an organic juice company at the farm.
column2: 荷马穿上了莫娜留下的一件肮脏的旧雨披，开始携带飞盘，但得知赛斯和蒙奇在农场经营一家有机果汁公司时，他感到沮丧。

column1: He persuades them to accompany him on a "freak-out" ride through Springfield, disrupting the citizens' daily lives with silly antics.
column2: 荷马说服赛斯和蒙奇陪他一起在春田镇 (Springfield) 进行「疯狂」的旅程，用愚蠢的滑稽动作扰乱了市民的日常生活。

column1: When the three return to the farm afterward, though, they find that Homer's frisbee has jammed the juicing machinery and caused the loss of an entire shipment of the farm's products.
column2: 然而，当三人回到农场后，他们发现荷马的飞盘卡住了榨汁机械，并导致整个农场产品的运输损失。

column1: Seth and Munchie angrily order Homer to leave.
column2: 赛斯和蒙奇愤怒地命令荷马离开。

column1: To set things right, Homer sneaks back to the farm at night, picks and processes all the vegetables he can find, and delivers the juice shipment to Springfield.
column2: 为了把事情做好，荷马晚上偷偷溜回农场，挑选并处理了他能找到的所有蔬菜，然后将果汁运到春田镇。

column1: In so doing, he unknowingly harvests a hidden field of peyote, which Seth and Munchie had intended for their personal use as recreational drugs.
column2: 在过程中，荷马在不知不觉中采收一片隐藏的乌羽玉田地，这是赛斯和蒙奇打算作为娱乐性毒品供他们个人使用的。

column1: The juice causes intense psychedelic hallucinations in those who drink it, and the police quickly trace it to the farm and move in to arrest Homer, Seth, and Munchie.
column2: 喝这种果汁的人会产生强烈的迷幻幻觉，员警迅速追踪到农场并进入逮捕荷马、赛斯和蒙奇。

column1: Homer defends Seth and Munchie by placing himself in the officers' path, reminding them of the morals and values from the 1960s, and placing a flower in the barrel of each officer's rifle.
column2: 荷马为赛斯和蒙奇辩护，将自己假想是警官上，提醒他们 1960 年代的道德和价值观，并在每个警官的步枪枪管中放置一朵花。

column1: When Chief Wiggum fires, Homer ends up hospitalized with one of the flowers lodged in his skull.
column2: 当维古姆 (Wiggum) 警长开枪时，荷马最终住院，其中一朵花卡在他的头骨里。

column1: D'oh-in' in the Wind was written by Donick Cary and directed by Mark Kirkland and Matthew Nastuk.
column2: 《D'oh-in' in the Wind》由 Donick Cary 编剧，Mark Kirkland 和 Matthew Nastuk 执导。

column1: It was first broadcast on the Fox network in the United States on November 15, 1998.
column2: 这一集于 1998 年 11 月 15 日在美国福克斯电视网首次播出。

column1: The idea for the episode was pitched by Cary, who thought it would be fun to see the citizens of Springfield hallucinating.
column2: 这一集的想法是由卡里 (Cary) 提出的，他认为看到春田镇的公民产生幻觉会很有趣。

column1: He then fleshed it out, forming its current iteration.
column2: 然后，他充实了内容，形成目前的反覆桥段。

column1: The episode features the revelation of Homer's middle name, "Jay", which is a "tribute" to animated characters such as Bullwinkle J. Moose and Rocket J. Squirrel from The Rocky and Bullwinkle Show who got their middle initial from Jay Ward.
column2: 这一集的特色是荷马的中间名「杰伊」的启示，这是对动画人物的「致敬」，如《鹿兄鼠弟》(The Rocky and Bullwinkle) 中的 Bullwinkle J. Moose 和 Rocket J. Squirrel，他们从 Jay Ward 沿用他们的中间名首字母。

column1: The name was pitched on for three days by the writers.
column2: 这个名字被作家们用了三天。

column1: DE 62 heads southeast from DE 2 (Kirkwood Highway) on the Newport Gap Pike, a two-lane undivided road.
column2: DE 62 从 DE 2 (柯克伍德高速公路 (Kirkwood Highway)) 沿着 Newport Gap Pike 向东南方向延行，这是一条无左右行车线的双车道道路。

column1: Newport Gap Pike continues northwest past this intersection as DE 41.
column2: Newport Gap Pike 继续向西北方向延行，经过这个交叉路口成为 DE 41。

column1: The road crosses Old Capitol Trail, which marks the official beginning of the route.
column2: 这条路穿过旧国会大厦小径，这标志着路线的正式开始。

column1: DE 62 heads through suburban residential and commercial developments, crossing the Wilmington and Western Railroad and CSX's Philadelphia Subdivision railroad line.
column2: DE 62 穿过郊区住宅和商业开发区，穿过威尔明顿和西部铁路 (Wilmington and Western Railroad) 以及 CSX 的费城分区 (Philadelphia Subdivision) 铁路线。

column1: The road passes more development and reaches the community of Belvedere, where it comes to a ramp from southbound DE 141.
column2: 这条路经过更多的开发区，到达 Belvedere 社区，在此处衔接南行的 DE 141 的坡道。

column1: At this point, the route turns east onto Boxwood Road, a four-lane divided highway, with Newport Gap Pike continuing south to provide access to southbound DE 141.
column2: 此时，路线向东转入 Boxwood Road 四车道高速公路，Newport Gap Pike 继续南行，提供通往南行 DE 141 的通道。

column1: DE 62 passes over the DE 141 freeway and intersects Centerville Road, which provides access to and from northbound DE 141.
column2: DE 62 穿过 DE 141 高速公路，与提供往返于北行 DE 141 通道的森特维尔路 (Centerville Road) 相交。

column1: Past this intersection, the road becomes two lanes and undivided, passing to the south of the former Wilmington Assembly plant used by General Motors and to the north of residential subdivisions.
column2: 经过这个十字路口，道路变成无左右行车线的两条车道，穿过通用汽车公司 (General Motors) 使用的前威尔明顿装配厂 (Wilmington Assembly) 的南部和住宅区的北部。

column1: DE 62 continues through more residential neighborhoods, passing to the north of the Conrad Schools of Science, and reaches an intersection with DE 4, where DE 62 signage ends.
column2: DE 62 继续穿过更多的住宅区，经过康拉德科学学院 (Conrad Schools of Science) 的北部，到达与 DE 4 的交叉路口，DE 62 标志于此处结束。

column1: The route officially continues east on Middleboro Road through more neighborhoods, intersecting Dupont Road before coming to a dead end.
column2: 这条路线正式沿着米德尔伯勒路 (Middleboro Road) 向东延伸，穿过更多的社区，与杜邦路 (Dupont Road) 相交，然后走到死胡同。

column1: DE 62 has an annual average daily traffic count ranging from a high of 23,750 vehicles at the intersection of Newport Gap Pike and Boxwood Road to a low of 283 vehicles at the eastern terminus.
column2: DE 62 的年平均每日交通量从 Newport Gap Pike 与 Boxwood Road 交叉口的 23,750 辆车到东部终点站的 283 辆车不等。

column1: None of DE 62 is part of the National Highway System.
column2: DE 62 都不是国家公路系统的一部分。

column1: What is now the Newport Gap Pike portion of DE 62 was originally chartered as the Gap and Newport Turnpike in 1808, an extension of the 1807-chartered turnpike in Pennsylvania that was to run from Gap, Pennsylvania, southeast to Newport, Delaware.
column2: DE 62 现在的 Newport Gap Pike 部分最初于 1808 年被特许为 Gap and Newport Turnpike，这是宾夕法尼亚州 1807 年特许收费公路的延伸，该收费公路将从宾夕法尼亚州的 Gap 向东南延伸至特拉华州纽波特 (Newport, Delaware)。

column1: By 1920, what is now DE 62 existed as a county road.
column2: 到 1920 年，现在的 DE 62 作为县道存在。

column1: The Newport Gap Pike portion of the route became a state highway by 1925.
column2: 到 1925 年，该路线的 Newport Gap Pike 部分成为一条国道。

column1: This state highway became a part of DE 41 by 1936, when Delaware designated its state highways.
column2: 到 1936 年，这条州际公路成为 DE 41 的一部分，当时特拉华州指定为州道。

column1: In 1946, Boxwood Road was improved to provide access to the new General Motors plant along the road.
column2: 1946 年，Boxwood Road 路进行了改善，可沿路提供通往新通用汽车工厂的通道。

column1: By 1981, DE 62 was designated onto its current alignment, with the Newport Gap Pike section replacing a portion of DE 41.
column2: 到 1981 年，DE 62 被指定为目前的路线，Newport Gap Pike 部分取代了 DE 41 的一部分。

column1: In a world where people with superpowers (known as "Quirks" (個性 Kosei)) are the norm, Izuku Midoriya has dreams of one day becoming a Hero, despite being bullied by his classmates for not having a Quirk.
column2: 在人拥有超能力 (被称为「Quirks」(个性 Kosei)) 是常态的世界里，绿谷出久 (Izuku Midoriya) 梦想着有一天成为英雄，尽管他的同学因为没有 Quirk 而被欺负。

column1: After being the only one to try and save his childhood bully Katsuki Bakugo from a villain, Japan's greatest Hero All Might saves him and bestows upon him All Might's own Quirk "One For All".
column2: 在成为唯一试图从恶棍手中拯救他童年恶霸爆豪胜己 (Katsuki Bakugo) 的人之后，日本最伟大的英雄欧尔麦特 (All Might) 拯救了他，并赋予欧尔麦特自己的 Quirk「One For All」给他。

column1: The story follows Izuku's entrance into U.A. High School (雄英高校 Yūei Kōkō), a school for training the next generation of superheroes.
column2: 故事讲述了绿谷进入美国高中 (雄英高校 Yūei Kōkō) 的故事，这是一所培养下一代超级英雄的学校。

column1: Izuku and his new friends try to balance their Hero training with ordinary school duties.
column2: 绿谷和他的新朋友试图在他们的英雄训练与普通的学校职责之间取得平衡。

column1: However, the League of Villains, an evil organization established by All Might's archenemy All For One, has plans to destroy all Heroes and take control of society.
column2: 然而，由欧尔麦特的宿敌 All For One 建立的邪恶组织反派联盟计划摧毁所有英雄并控制社会。

column1: My Hero Academia is a Japanese manga series written and illustrated by Kōhei Horikoshi.
column2: 《我的英雄学院》是一部日本漫画系列，由堀越浩平创作和插画。

column1: It originated from the one-shot My Hero (僕のヒーロー Boku no Hīrō), which Horikoshi wanted to turn into a series following the end of Barrage.
column2: 此漫画起源于单镜头的 My Hero (仆のヒーロー Boku no Hīrō)，堀越想在弹幕结束后将其变成一个系列。

column1: It began its serialization in the manga magazine Weekly Shōnen Jump on July 7, 2014.
column2: 此漫画于 2014 年 7 月 7 日开始在漫画杂志《周刊少年 Jump》上连载。

column1: As of August 2, 2019, the series has been collected into twenty-four tankōbon volumes.
column2: 截至 2019 年 8 月 2 日，该系列已被收集成 24 卷。

column1: The series is licensed for the English-language release in North America by Viz Media, who published the first volume on August 4, 2015.
column2: 该系列由 Viz Media 授权在北美发行英文版，Viz Media 于 2015 年 8 月 4 日出版了第一卷。

column1: As the series is published in Japan, it is also released simultaneously in English digitally by Viz Media's Weekly Shōnen Jump.
column2: 该系列除了在日本发行外，同时也由 Viz Media 以英文发行数位版少年跳跃周刊。

column1: As of August 7, 2018, 14 volumes have been released.
column2: 截至 2018 年 8 月 7 日，一共推出 14 集。

column1: Shueisha began to simulpublish the series in English on the website and app Manga Plus in January 2019.
column2: 集英社于 2019 年 1 月起在其网站与 app Manga Plus 同步发行英文版。

column1: A spin-off series entitled My Hero Academia Smash!!
column2: 另外衍生出《我的英雄学院 Smash!!》系列。

column1: by Hirofumi Neda started in the Jump+ digital app on November 9, 2015 and finished on November 6, 2017.
column2: 作者为根田启史，数位版于 2015 年 11 月 9 日开始于 Jump+ app 开始连载，于 2017 年 11 月 6 日结束。

column1: Five tankōbon volumes were released as of November 2017.
column2: 截至 2017 年 11 月，共推出 5 册单行本。

column1: The series has been licensed by Viz Media.
column2: 该系列由 Viz Media 取得授权。

column1: Another spin-off series, My Hero Academia: Vigilantes, began being published by Weekly Shōnen Jump in 2017.
column2: 其他衍生作品《正义使者－我的英雄学院之非法英雄》，于 2017 年起在少年跳跃周刊开始连载。

column1: The series is licensed for the English-language release in North America by Viz Media.
column2: 由 Viz Media 取得该系列英文版的北美发行权。

column1: The first volume was released in English on July 3, 2018.
column2: 英文版第一册于 2018 年 7 月 3 日出版。

column1: On 30 July 1502, during his fourth voyage, Christopher Columbus arrived at Guanaja, one of the Bay Islands off the coast of Honduras.
column2: 1502 年 7 月 30 日，克里斯多福・哥伦布来到瓜纳哈，这是宏都拉斯海岸诸岛的其中之一。

column1: He sent his brother Bartholomew to scout the island.
column2: 哥伦布派他弟弟巴托罗谬到岛上进行探查。

column1: As Bartholomew explored the island with two boats, a large canoe approached from the west, apparently en route to the island.
column2: 当巴托罗谬带着两艘船探索该岛时，有艘大型独木舟自西方驶来，显然是要往岛上前进。

column1: The canoe was carved from one large tree trunk and was powered by twenty-five naked rowers.
column2: 那艘独木舟以一棵大树刻成，由 25 个裸体划船手划动。

column1: Curious as to the visitors, Bartholomew Columbus seized and boarded it.
column2: 出自造访者的好奇，巴托罗谬拦截并登上独木舟。

column1: He found it was a Maya trading canoe from Yucatán, carrying well-dressed Maya and a rich cargo that included ceramics, cotton textiles, yellow stone axes, flint-studded war clubs, copper axes and bells, and cacao.
column2: 他发现这是艘来自犹加敦的马雅贸易船，船上有精心打扮的马雅人，还有一个装满瓷器、绵织品、黄石斧、以燧石装饰的作战用棍棒、铜斧、钟、可可等物品的货箱。

column1: Also among the cargo were a small number of women and children, probably destined to be sold as slaves, as were a number of the rowers.
column2: 货物之外，还有几个女人和孩童，可能是被抓来的奴隶，也充当划船手。

column1: The Europeans looted whatever took their interest from amongst the cargo and seized the elderly Maya captain to serve as an interpreter; the canoe was then allowed to continue on its way.
column2: 这些欧洲人把他们看上的货物抢走，抓了一名老马雅船长当通译，然后放走独木舟，让它继续旅程。

column1: This was the first recorded contact between Europeans and the Maya.
column2: 这是史上首次欧洲人与马雅人接触的记录。

column1: It is likely that news of the piratical strangers in the Caribbean passed along the Maya trade routes – the first prophecies of bearded invaders sent by Kukulkan, the northern Maya feathered serpent god, were probably recorded around this time, and in due course passed into the books of Chilam Balam.
column2: 在加勒比海出现陌生海盗的消息，沿着马雅贸易路径传递；由马雅北边羽蛇神库库尔坎首次做出的胡子入侵者预言，也差不多是在此时写入了 奇兰巴兰之书。

column1: In 1511 the Spanish caravel Santa María de la Barca set sail along the Central American coast under the command of Pedro de Valdivia.
column2: 1511 年，西班牙帆船「巴卡的圣玛利亚号」，在佩德罗・德・巴尔狄维亚指挥下，沿中美洲海岸航行。

column1: The ship was sailing to Santo Domingo from Darién to inform the colonial authorities there of ongoing conflict between conquistadors Diego de Nicuesa and Vasco Nuñez de Balboa in Darién.
column2: 该船自达里恩驶向圣多明哥，以向当地殖民统治者通报关于征服者狄亚哥・德・尼古萨与巴斯可・努涅兹・德・巴尔柏之间愈演愈烈的冲突。

column1: The ship foundered upon a reef known as Las Víboras ("The Vipers") or, alternatively, Los Alacranes ("The Scorpions"), somewhere off Jamaica.
column2: 这艘船后来在一个称为「毒蛇」或是「蝎子」的暗礁触礁沉没，地点在牙买加附近。

column1: There were just twenty survivors from the wreck, including Captain Valdivia, Gerónimo de Aguilar and Gonzalo Guerrero.
column2: 船难中只有 20 人生还，包括船长巴尔狄维亚、杰罗尼莫・德・阿吉拉尔、贡萨罗・格雷洛。

column1: They set themselves adrift in one of the ship's boats, with bad oars and no sail; after thirteen days during which half of the survivors died, they made landfall upon the coast of Yucatán.
column2: 他们坐着船上的小艇在海上漂流，桨坏了，也没有船帆；13 天后，一半的生还者也死了。最后在犹加敦海边上岸。

column1: There they were seized by Halach Uinik, a Maya lord. Captain Vildivia was sacrificed with four of his companions, and their flesh was served at a feast.
column2: 这些人被马雅贵族哈拉奇・乌以尼克捕获。巴狄维亚船长犠牲了四个同伴才活下来，他们的肉被煮来吃。

column1: Aguilar and Guerrero were held prisoner and fattened for killing, together with five or six of their shipmates.
column2: 阿吉拉尔、格雷洛和另外五六个人被关起来，养肥了待宰。

column1: Aguilar and Guerrero managed to escape their captors and fled to a neighbouring lord who was an enemy of Halach Uinik; he took them prisoner and kept them as slaves.
column2: 阿吉拉尔和格雷洛成功越狱，逃到邻近与哈拉奇・乌以尼克为敌的贵族那里；但两人被当做囚犯，成了奴隶。

column1: After a time, Gonzalo Guerrero was passed as a slave to the lord Nachan Can of Chetumal.
column2: 不久后，贡萨罗・格雷洛以奴隶之身，被送到切图马尔贵族纳坎・坎处。

column1: Guerrero became completely Mayanised and served his new lord with such loyalty that he was married to one of Nachan Chan's daughters, Zazil Ha, by whom he had three children.
column2: 格雷洛完全马雅化，忠心侍奉新主人，后来取了纳坎・坎的女儿莎吉尔・哈，生了三个孩子。

column1: The Acra was not the first Hellenistic stronghold in Jerusalem.
column2: 阿克拉不是耶路撒冷头一个希腊要塞。

column1: Sources indicate that an earlier citadel, the Ptolemaic Baris, had also occupied a location overlooking the Temple's precincts.
column2: 资料指出有一个更早的要塞托勒密堡垒，曾经占有一个可以监视神庙区域的地点。

column1: Although the exact location of the Baris is still debated, it is generally accepted to have stood north of the Temple Mount on the site later occupied by the Antonia Fortress.
column2: 该堡垒实际所在地点虽然仍在争议之中，但大家都同意的说法，是它位于神庙山的北侧，后来该地成为安东尼亚要塞所在地。

column1: The Baris fell to Antiochus III at the turn of the 2nd century BCE and is absent from all accounts of the Maccabean Revolt.
column2: 在进入西元前 2 世纪时，该堡垒落入安条克三世之手，而且在马加比起义中的所有述说中都未曾提及。

column1: Despite the narratives which have the Acra constructed within a very short time-span, it was nevertheless formidable enough to weather long periods of siege.
column2: 虽然各种说法都指出阿克拉是在极短时间内建成，但仍然足以抵御长期的围困。

column1: These factors, coupled with references in which the Baris was itself called an acra, have led some to suggest that the Baris and the Acra were in fact the same structure.
column2: 因为这些原因，再加上该堡垒也有人称之为一个阿克拉，因此也有人说这两者其实是同一个建筑物。

column1: Although both 1 Maccabees and Josephus seem to describe the Acra as a new construction, this may not have been the case.
column2: 虽然马加比一世和约瑟夫斯都把阿克拉当做新建筑物，但事实可能并非如此。

column1: Antiquities of the Jews 12:253 may be translated to give the sense that the "impious or wicked" had "remained" rather than "dwelt" in the citadel, which could be taken to mean that the Acra had been standing before the revolt and that only the Macedonian garrison was new.
column2: 犹太古史 12:253 或许会让人以为「亵渎者或恶人」「仍然驻守」而非「住在」该堡垒中，但也可以认为阿克拉早在起义前就已建成，只有马其顿要塞才是新建的。

column1: Koen Decoster proposes that Josephus wrote of "a citadel in the lower part of the city" to an audience that would have been familiar with the Jerusalem of the 1st century CE—a city that did feature two citadels: the Antonia Fortress and the Herodian palace.
column2: 柯恩・迪可斯特认为约瑟夫斯写下的「在城市下方的堡垒」，对读者来说可能像西元后第一世纪的耶路撒冷一样熟悉，该城市正好有两座要塞：安东尼亚要塞与希腊神殿。

column1: As Josephus' Roman Jerusalem had already expanded to the higher western hill, "a citadel in the lower city" could have referred to anything located east of the Tyropoeon Valley, including the Antonia which stood north of the Temple and did indeed rise above and dominate it.
column2: 约瑟夫斯所写的罗马化耶路撒冷，城区已扩及西边的高丘上，因此「在城市下方的堡垒」指的可能是任何在泰罗边谷东边的地方，包括树立在神庙北方，确实崛起并控制神庙的安东尼亚。
